name: Enviro HP1200+900
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
AS4654.2-2012; Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet
Check substrate - Check for cracks/defect in concrete. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns).
Attach Photo of substrate. [POL HOLD POINT] / [MPX WITNESS POINT]
Prepare surface to accept primer using scraper (and/or light grind) and vacuum/sweep residual debris. Remove all concrete/mortar projections.
Moisture Content Test.
Attach Photo of moiture reading or enter moisture reading in comment section. [POL HOLD POINT] / [MPX HOLD POINT]
Apply primer using a brush or roller
Visual inspection, ensure adequately cured. [MPX WITNESS POINT]
Caulking - Apply Enviro Flex FC / PRO to the junction between floor slab and walls. [MPX WITNESS POINT]

Mixing. Mix HP 1200. Mixing by way of 1:1 mix ratio (by volume) in heated plural component spray equipment such as Graco E-10 or EXP-2. Both low and high pressure spray equipment can be used for the application of Enviro HP1200. [MPX WITNESS POINT]
Apply Enviro HP1200 using a spray gun. Achieve 1.5mm DFT.
Attach photo. [MPX HOLD POINT]
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test.
Attach Photo. [MPX WITNESS POINT]
DFT Testing
Attach Photo. Enter DFT reading on comment section. [MPX HOLD POINT]
Wear Coat - Mix and Apply Enviro 900 with brush or new roller (spray application optional). Broadcast aggregate uniformly to the wet Enviro 900 within the timeframes specified
Attach Photo. [MPX WITNESS POINT]
Final Inspection and Sign-off. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured - DO NOT PASS UNTIL HOLDPOINT COMPLETE BELOW
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF
